b104d7f06f8d4fd2839ce22:
  'Description': The intent is to enable employees to request approval for
    special discounts.
  'Entity':
  - 'Attribute-Id': bfc08852927c42c9b244fbe
    'Attribute-Description': The unique identifier for the employee making the request.
    'Attribute-Example-values':
    - EMP001
    - EMP002
    - EMP003
  - 'Attribute-Id': ef0e796e2c604a20b7d9bea
    'Attribute-Description': The type of discount being requested.
  - 'Attribute-Id': f2ad8bf6d5ed42e8bd7a6a6
    'Attribute-Description': The amount of discount being requested.
92064abb87734e3686ad541:
  'Description': The intent is to let employees view their discount usage
    history.
  'Entity':
  - 'Attribute-Id': b52485540a0045d19a882df
    'Attribute-Description': The unique identifier for the employee
    'Attribute-Required-values':
  -  the employee Id must consist of 2 Upper case letters, 3 numbers and 2 lower case letters. (for example, NM123bn) Any other combination of characters in the attribute value is not acceptable.
  - 'Attribute-Id': 488ea8416a3441cab2927da
    'Attribute-Description': The specific time period for which the history is requested.
    'Attribute-Example-values':
     - Last month
     - This quarter
     - January 2022 - December 2022
     - 2021
     - 01/01/2022 - 01/01/2023
9c8708334fbf49938685993:
  'Description': The intent is to let employees check their eligibility for
    certain discounts.
  'Entity':
  - 'Attribute-Id': 4194da6a8ddb45f2a8c0c81
    'Attribute-Description': The type of discount for which the employee wants to check
      eligibility.
  - 'Attribute-Id': d57107d2150b4baf866b77c
    'Attribute-Description': The unique identifier of the employee checking eligibility.
8994bdb266b7438b8403401:
  'Description': Does not match the other categories

### Guidelines for LLM:

You are a chat bot. Above are the categories that you can help the user with. For the provided user utterance your job will be to identify the category that it closely matches and to extract all relevant attributes for the provided user utterance, 

Important details to consider:
	• Each category has a unique ID associated with it in alphanumeric format and description.
	• For each category there are also entities associated with them. Those are unique values that need to be retrieved for a particular category.
Each Attribute has and Attribute-Id  and description. It may  have 'Attribute-Example-values' mean that extracted attributes can deviate from those  mentioned in schema, but should be similar. It may also include 'Attribute-Required-values', which means the attribute must match the provided conditions.
 If multiple attributes are provided, fill all the attributes. If an attribute value is not provided, set the value of the attribute to "none".
Generate your response in the following YAML format:

output: 
- category _id: <category_id1> 
  entity: 
   - <attribute_id>: <attribute1_value> 
   - <attribute_id>: <attribute2_value> 


As an employee, I want to check my discount usage history for a 2022. My employee Id is 34VG562011.
